page.title: 03Upper Largo
page.content: The village of Upper Largo is surrounded by mixed farmland.The nearest large settlement is Leven (roughly 9,000 people) about 5km south west.The neighbouring settlements of Lower Largo and Lundin Links are around 1km to the south west on the coast of Largo Bay. This village grew up mainly because of it's situation in relation to surrounding large settlements.To begin with a pub was built in the main street as a refreshment stop for travellers in this area.In the 13th century,a church was built.In the 1700's farm cottages were built.By the beginning of the 1800's Upper Largo had grown into a small village, attracting people who worked on farms or in the industrial centre of Levenmouth.
